summary: This bill, the US-Japan-ROK Trilateral Cooperation Act, aims to strengthen cooperation between the United States, Japan, and the Republic of Korea. It proposes establishing a US-Japan-ROK Inter-Parliamentary Dialogue to facilitate closer collaboration on shared interests and values. The bill outlines the structure of the US delegation, including membership, appointments, meeting guidelines, and reporting requirements. It emphasizes enhancing trilateral cooperation in areas like regional security, freedom of navigation, countering foreign information manipulation, and regularizing trilateral leaders’ summits.
